intro: Trichera arvensis var. isantha, commonly known as the field trichera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Trichera arvensis var. isantha is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
